body:
- What goals are made of

- How to identify goals in conversation and on paper

- How to set goals

- How to make your goals stick

- Lots of opportunities to practice
title: Text Title

displayTitle: What Makes Up A S.M.A.R.T. Goal?
body:
You've likely heard of S.M.A.R.T. goals (and if you haven't, don't worry. You're in the right spot!)


S.M.A.R.T. is an acronym for the 5 components of an efficient goal. The acronym stands for Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Timely. 


Include these 5 points, and you'll have a S.M.A.R.T. goal!


Let's take a closer look at each component.

_items.title: SPECIFIC
_items.body: Multiple dialog components throughout the course with small chunks of a larger conversation in each.
Multiple dialog components throughout the course with short conversations in each.
_items.title: MEASURABLE
ACHIEVABLE
_items.body: Multiple dialog components throughout the course with short conversations in each, after each dialog component add an MCQ or Text Reveal component to further question the learner.
One dialog component summarising the content prior to it.
_items.title: RELEVANT
TIMELY
_items.body: One dialog component introducing the content following it.

title: SMART GOALS MAKEUP

body:
Now that you are able to identify parts of a written S.M.A.R.T. goal, let's understand how that looks in a conversation. It can often be more difficult to identify parts of a S.M.A.R.T. goal when we are communicating with others, because many other factors come into play. We have to account for emotions, other people's responses, and of course our relationship with that person. 


Whether you’re meeting someone new or conversing within an existing relationship, the ability to build efficient goals is imperative.
title: Text Title

body: Before we move onto how you can set S.M.A.R.T. goals, let's take a look at an example of a S.M.A.R.T. goal setting between a manager and an employee.
instruction: Pick out the S.M.A.R.T. goal components that you see in this conversation.
displayTitle: Spotting Parts of a S.M.A.R.T. Goal

_items.body: Hey Alice! Are you ready to get started with our meeting?
I am, thanks. I was hoping to write a goal that I can try to meet by our quarterly review.
That sounds great. What's the goal?
I'm thinking something around my productivity with projects.
That's a great idea, especially since you are interested in project management. We are heading into a very busy season. Do you think increasing your productivity will be doable for you?
I think it will be. I have already looked at my schedule and carved out time specifically for this goal.
Fantastic! I can't wait to see what you achieve!

title: Dialog Title

displayTitle: What parts of a S.M.A.R.T. goal did you see?

_incorrect.final:
Good try! You should have chosen:


Specific - Alice wants to increase her productivity on the project team

Achievable - Alice built time in her schedule to work on this

Relevant - related to Alice's career goal

Timely - before the next quarterly review


Alice's goal is not measurable. We don't know how she will increase her productivity. Will she pick up 2 new projects in the next month? Will she complete 1 unfinished project by next week? 


Remember, we need all 5 parts of a S.M.A.R.T. goal!

_partlyCorrect.final:
Almost! You should have chosen:


Specific - Alice wants to increase her productivity on the project team

Achievable - Alice built time in her schedule to work on this

Relevant - related to Alice's career goal

Timely - before the next quarterly review


Alice's goal is not measurable. We don't know how she will increase her productivity. Will she pick up 2 new projects in the next month? Will she complete 1 unfinished project by next week? 


Remember, we need all 5 parts of a S.M.A.R.T. goal!

_feedback.correct:
You got it! 


Specific - Alice wants to increase her productivity on the project team

Achievable - Alice built time in her schedule to work on this

Relevant - related to Alice's career goal

Timely - before the next quarterly review


Alice's goal is not measurable. We don't know how she will increase her productivity. Will she pick up 2 new projects in the next month? Will she complete 1 unfinished project by next week? 


Remember, we need all 5 parts of a S.M.A.R.T. goal!

title: MCQ Title

body:
There are a few key behaviors to help ensure we achieve the S.M.A.R.T. goals that we set. 


Read on to learn how what you see, hear, and say can help you reach your goals.

_items.text:
• Watch for potential areas of growth that can be celebrated. Small steps are still steps towards that goal of yours!
  • Keep goals visible and attainable. Write them down and keep them somewhere where you will see them often. People who very vividly describe or picture their goals are anywhere from 1.2 to 1.4 times more likely to successfully accomplish their goals than people who don’t. 
  • Observe the steps others take to achieve their goals. Consider asking a trusted peer or supervisor to mentor you through the goal achievement process.
_items.title: Observe

_items.text:
• Don't be afraid to take goal advice from peers, managers, and trusted people in your life. Multiple experiences provide multiple perspectives, which can sometimes be helpful!
  • Listen to feedback, but also listen to your instincts. While it can be helpful to heed the advice of others in this process, remember - at the end of the day, it's your goal and you're the one who will be working towards it! Do what you think is best.
_items.title: Listen

_items.text:
• Cheer yourself on. When you find yourself doubting if you can reach your goal, shift your negative self-talk into positive. Instead of “It’s too hard,” try “I’ll tackle this with a different strategy.”
  • Share your goals with others who you trust. Consider asking someone to be your accountability partner. Individuals who have a goal are 10% likely to achieve it, as opposed to 65% likely when they tell someone else that they will achieve it.
_items.title: Speak

title: Text Reveal Title

displayTitle: So how do you set S.M.A.R.T. goals?
body:
So here's what you were waiting for! How you actually set a goal! 


I'll let you in on a secret - there isn't a tried and true set process on how to set a goal. (I know. Bummer)


Don't get me wrong, there are guidelines. For example, it's best to define the goal before deciding on the strategy. (Imagine trying to answer How do I do this? before even knowing what this is.)


The steps outlined below are just that - an outline. By following this process, you will learn what works for you and be able to define this process for yourself moving forward.


But for now, go ahead and start here. Learn the basic steps, and adjust as needed for your individual situation.
title: Text Title

body:
So, we've covered some key topics to help you build your S.M.A.R.T. goal:


  • What goes into S.M.A.R.T. goals
  • How to identify S.M.A.R.T. goals 
  • How to build your own S.M.A.R.T. goals


You're now free to go set and achieve your own goals! Remember, you can do this!
title: Text Title

_items.itemTitle: Click here to close the page

_items.body: SPECIFIC - Luis will increase his attendance.
_items.title: SPECIFIC

_items.body: MEASURABLE - How will Luis meet his goal? By being on time 4 days/week.
_items.title: MEASURABLE

_items.body: ACHIEVABLE - Luis is currently on-time 3 days/week. 4 days can be considered an achievable increase.
_items.title: ACHIEVABLE

_items.body: RELEVANT - Luis just started a new job, making this goal relevant since Luis likely wants to keep the job he just started.
_items.title: RELEVANT

_items.body: TIMELY - Luis will meet this goal by March 2022.
_items.title: TIMELY

_feedback.correct:
Fantastic! You have built a S.M.A.R.T. goal.


Nyla will pay off her debt by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100 and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget, resulting in being debt-free by September 2024 so that she can buy her dream house.


SPECIFIC - Nyla will pay off her debt

MEASURABLE - by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100

ACHIEVABLE - and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget

RELEVANT - being debt-free so that can buy her dream house

TIMELY - by September 2024

_incorrect.final:
So close! You should have had:


Nyla will pay off her debt by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100 and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget, resulting in being debt-free by September 2024 so that she can buy her dream house.


SPECIFIC - Nyla will pay off her debt

MEASURABLE - by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100

ACHIEVABLE - and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget

RELEVANT - being debt-free so that can buy her dream house

TIMELY - by September 2024

_partlyCorrect.final:
So close! You should have had:


Nyla will pay off her debt by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100 and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget, resulting in being debt-free by September 2024 so that she can buy her dream house.


SPECIFIC - Nyla will pay off her debt

MEASURABLE - by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100

ACHIEVABLE - and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget

RELEVANT - being debt-free so that can buy her dream house

TIMELY - by September 2024

_items.text: resulting in being debt-free by September 2024
by increasing her monthly credit card payment by $100
and contacting credit card companies to negotiate payments that are within her budget
so that she can buy her dream house.
Nyla will pay off her debt

title: SORTING ACTIVITY
body: Re-order the 5 components to create a S.M.A.R.T. goal.

title: INTRO TO HOT GRAPHIC
body: Check out the goal to your right. Click each hotspot to understand the role each component plays in a S.M.A.R.T. goal.

_items.body:
Step 1. Determine The Goal

- What do I want to achieve?

- Is there something in my life that I want to change?

- Where do I see myself in 1 year? 5 years?

- What motivates me to reach this goal? (a.k.a. What's my why?)

- How will I know when I've met my goal?

Step 2. Map Out Steps

- If I start today, what are all of the steps I would need to take to meet my goal? (I would suggest writing these down. There should be at least 5-10 minimum.)

- Are there supplies necessary to meet my goal?

- Are there other people whose support I will need in any of these steps?

- What should it look like to be halfway to my goal? (You can also answer this question with time. i.e. Where should I be in 1 month?)

Step 3. Plan For The Unxexpected

- What could come up that would make this process harder?

- Am I able to make this happen with my current circumstances? If not, what do I need to change or adjust?

Step 4. Set a timeframe

- When do I want to complete my goal?

- Is my completion date flexible?

- How long do I have to complete my goal? (After you answer this question, make sure to make sure you can fit in all of your steps from Step 2 into this timeline.)
